org.gruth.tools

Class SingleTestReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gruth.tools.SingleTestReport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SingleTestReport
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is part of an abstract layer that enables any java code to publish GRU-like reports (though these may not be exactly gru reports).

    A SingleTestReport object gather all data pertaining to a given test. So, for example, if a given test is about invoking a constructor or method there may be various SimpleAssertion objects that are evaluated, collected and published as part of an instance of SingleTestReport object (please beware of the plural to distinguish thos two kinds of objects).
    Note that SingleTestReport instances should be considered as objects that report test results: these tests are not necessarily "terminal" and may be about anything (for instance for reporting scalability informations).

    See the GRU tutorial for examples of uses in Junit codes ("terminal" tests) or Java assert statements ("on the fly" tests).

    Programmers that use such objects should take care because there should be a way to make them unique (for instance in the context of a database). It's up to the developers to decide which combination of fields is unique; they can use:

    • testName (this field should be a minimum key: is is used in the management of a report cache)
    • class Name
    • method (or constructor) identification
    • the current object
    • the set of invocation arguments

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • reporters

        static java.util.ArrayList<SingleTestReport.Reporter> reporters
        the list of Reporters initialized by the deployment static code.

      • lastReports

        protected static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SingleTestReport> lastReports
        a cache of unpublished reports. will be emptied when the flush() method is invoked. This flush is guaranteed to happen when the JVM stops. The size of the cache is 20 (but could be changed by System property "gruth.lastReportsSize") when the number of reports in cache overflows the eldest entry is published and removed.

      • reportMonitor

        static java.lang.Object reportMonitor
        monitor for handling LastReports (reports cache)

      • testName

        private java.lang.String testName
        the name of the test: mandatory

      • methodName

        private java.lang.String methodName
        name of invocation code : "<init>" is for the name of a constructor. the name may be null (the instance is used for other purposes than test a method or constructor invocation

      • clazz

        private java.lang.Class clazz
        current class (may be null)

      • currentObject

        private transient java.lang.Object currentObject
        optional current object. if this instance is Serialized will be replaced by a String if the object is not serializable.

      • result

        private transient java.lang.Object result
        optional result of an invocation. If not serializable will be replace by a String if the current instance is Serialized

      • data

        private transient java.lang.Object data
        optional additional data.

      • invocationArguments

        private transient java.lang.Object[] invocationArguments
        can be empty but not null. any object in this array which is not serializable will be replaced by a String upon serialization.

      • assertionList

        private java.util.ArrayList<SimpleAssertion> assertionList
        can be empty but not null.

      • published

        transient boolean published
        really transient: not part of the instance state.

        Parameters:

        clazz - optional
        Returns:

      • _reportFor

        public static SingleTestReport _reportFor(java.lang.String testName)
        Report request. can be a factory method for just any kind of reporting (class information is null). This method has a different behaviour from other factories: if a report has been created with the same key (testName and if this report is still in the reports cache then this report is returned. This is useful when using SingleTestReports in Java assert statements (you do not have to keep a reference on reports outside the assert statements).
        Parameters:
        testName - mandatory
        Returns:

        public SingleTestReport okIf(boolean test,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.Object... args)
        factory method to add a SimpleAssertion to the current report.
        Parameters:

        message - core MessageFormat to be handled by formatting process
        args - aguments of the formatting process

        the current instance

      • publish

        public SingleTestReport publish()
        the current report is submitted to the reporters.

      • internalPublish

        private void internalPublish(boolean remove)
        private method that publishes and optionally removes a report from the reports cache.
        Parameters:
        remove -

      • ack

        public boolean ack()
        to be used to force the current instance to return a boolean to an invoking java assert statement. It operates this way:
        • first it publishes the current report
        • gets the name of the Diag enum constant in System property "gruth.failLevel" (if not set then the constant is FAILED).
        • invokes the overallDiagnostic method of the current instance
        • compares the result with the failLevel: if equals or less then return false.
        Returns:

      • yield

        public boolean yield()
        much like ack except that publication is only performed if the result is false. This method is to be used with assert statements: if the result is false then the assert will fail and all pending reports will be published.

      • hasFailed

        private boolean hasFailed()
        implementation of fail evaluation as described in ack() documentation.
        Returns:

      • overallDiagnostic

        public Diag overallDiagnostic()
        scans all the assertions in this report and returns the "worst" one (since Diag constants are ordered)
        Returns:
        worst diagnostics

      • ack

        public boolean ack(boolean bool)
        this method is useful to use with java assert statements: it forces a boolean return value for the current instance and this value will be used by the assert. side effect: it forces publishing of the current instance.
        Parameters:
        bool -
        Returns:

      • yield

        public boolean yield(boolean bool)
        much like ack(boolean) except that publication of pending reports will be performed only if the result is false.
        Parameters:
        bool -
        Returns:
